trans-unit.source: Create a volume container
trans-unit.target: Create a volume container

trans-unit.source: Describes how to create a volume container on a StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: Describes how to create a volume container on a StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: In the device Quick Start page, click Add a volume container.
trans-unit.target: In the device Quick Start page, click Add a volume container.

trans-unit.source: The Create Volume Container dialog box appears.
trans-unit.target: The Create Volume Container dialog box appears.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create Volume Container</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create Volume Container</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Create Volume container dialog box:
trans-unit.target: In the Create Volume container dialog box:

trans-unit.source: Supply a Name for your volume container.
trans-unit.target: Supply a Name for your volume container.

trans-unit.source: The name must be 3 to 32 characters long.
trans-unit.target: The name must be 3 to 32 characters long.

trans-unit.source: Select a Storage Account to associate with this volume container.
trans-unit.target: Select a Storage Account to associate with this volume container.

trans-unit.source: You can choose the default account that is generated at the time of service creation.
trans-unit.target: You can choose the default account that is generated at the time of service creation.

trans-unit.source: You can also use the Add new option to specify a storage account that is not linked to this service subscription.
trans-unit.target: You can also use the Add new option to specify a storage account that is not linked to this service subscription.

trans-unit.source: Select Enable Cloud Storage Encryption to enable encryption of the data sent from the device to the cloud.
trans-unit.target: Select Enable Cloud Storage Encryption to enable encryption of the data sent from the device to the cloud.

trans-unit.source: Provide and confirm a Cloud Storage Encryption Key that is 8 to 32 characters long.
trans-unit.target: Provide and confirm a Cloud Storage Encryption Key that is 8 to 32 characters long.

trans-unit.source: This key is used by the device to access encrypted data.
trans-unit.target: This key is used by the device to access encrypted data.

trans-unit.source: Select Unlimited in the Specify bandwidth drop-down list if you wish to consume all the available bandwidth.
trans-unit.target: Select Unlimited in the Specify bandwidth drop-down list if you wish to consume all the available bandwidth.

trans-unit.source: You can also set this option to Custom to employ bandwidth controls, and specify a value between 1 and 1,000 Mbps.
trans-unit.target: You can also set this option to Custom to employ bandwidth controls, and specify a value between 1 and 1,000 Mbps.

trans-unit.source: If you have your bandwidth usage information available, you may be able to allocate bandwidth based on a schedule by specifying Select a bandwidth template.
trans-unit.target: If you have your bandwidth usage information available, you may be able to allocate bandwidth based on a schedule by specifying Select a bandwidth template.

trans-unit.source: For a step-by-step procedure, go to <linkText>Add a bandwidth template</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For a step-by-step procedure, go to <linkText>Add a bandwidth template</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Click the check icon <linkText>check-icon</linkText> to save this volume container and exit the wizard.
trans-unit.target: Click the check icon <linkText>check-icon</linkText> to save this volume container and exit the wizard.

trans-unit.source: The newly created volume container will be listed on the Volume containers page.
trans-unit.target: The newly created volume container will be listed on the Volume containers page.
